Found a photo that clearly is a sequence, shows besides the other two women shown here, other women that seem to be related and a couple of what seems to be Americans, in Texas A & M University, University Libraries; Digital Library>>DSpacePrincipal>>Cushing Memorial Library>>Wheelan Collection of Mexican Revolution. 
hdl.handle.net/1969.1/849
hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.22110

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: In The Sun, issue March 30, 1914 !!!! (The Library of Congress, Historic Newspapers, Chronicling America) chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1914-03-30/ed-... The foot note reads Copyright by Mutual riliu Corporation. MRS. PANCHO VILLA. Wife of the rebel leader, who paraded the streets of Juarez in her automobile just before Curranza arrived shouting "Viva Villa' and the article Mrs. Villa la Evidence. Karly y Mrs. l'ancho Villa rode from in I'aso to Juurez In hor gaudily decorated seven passenger touring car and spent most of tho day riding up and down thn street of the city. "Viva Gen. Pnncho Villa !" In gold letters on the car caused thn rebel soldiers to cheer wherever she drove. Sometimes h had her cur full of people, sometimes she rode alone, but she rode through Juarez most of the day and was the most conspicuous figure In the border town. She seemed very nappy, but stopped often at the telegraph olllce and at the official residence of Gen. Manuel Chan, her hurbaml's Governor-Gener- al of the Stato of Chihuahua, to ask "Has anything been heard from Pancho? (NOTE: MISSPLELLING IS UNWILLING. JUST COPIED FROM THE ORIGINAL AND PASTED)
